author: Dan Gallagher
title: Salesforce Grows the Old-Fashioned Way
text:
Buying growth is an expensive proposition for software companies these days. Luckily for Salesforce.com, it seems to be managing just fine on its own.
The cloud software company reported $3 billion in revenue for the fiscal first quarter ended April 30. That was a record and an increase of 22% from the same period a year ago when adjusted for exchange rates. Those results donâ€™t reflect the inclusion of MuleSoft, the acquisition of which Salesforce closed just days after the reporting period ended.
